description: From Middle English glaser, variant of glasier; equivalent to glaze +â€Ž -er; compare glazier.

entries.meaning: One who applies glazing, as in pottery, etc.; one who gives a glasslike or glossy surface to anything; a calenderer or smoother of cloth, paper, etc.
(slang) A person who is prone to endless monologuing; derived from the practice of speaking until the listener's eyes "glaze over".
A glazier; one who fits glass.
